Ralph Plumley's Web Journal Probably posts about software development. Amongst other things. http://ralphplumley.com/ <<<<<<< HEAD Wed, 17 Jun 2015 22:30:08 -0400 Wed, 17 Jun 2015 22:30:08 -0400 Jekyll v2.5.3 Reading List

This my reading list for programming. I’ll update it with notes as I read them through my career.

Currently going through:

Code Complete: A Practical Handbook of Software Construction

To read:

  • Mythical Man Month
  • Code: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software
  • Introduction to Algorithms
  • tructure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
  • Pragmatic Programmer
  • Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
  • Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
  • Compilers: Principles, Techniques, and Tools
  • The Little Schemer
  • Programming Pearls
  • The New Turing Omnibus

Sources:
Jeff Atwood’s recommended reading for developers.
Peteris Krumins’ top 100 books part 1.
Peteris Krumins’ top 100 books part 2.
Peteris Krumins’ top 100 books part 3.

I’ll update my progress with C in this post. Answers are up on a [github repo][Github/Coderbyte].

Mon, 15 Jun 2015 21:00:00 -0400 http://ralphplumley.com/software/reading/practice/2015/06/15/reading-list/ http://ralphplumley.com/software/reading/practice/2015/06/15/reading-list/ software reading practice CoderByte

I’ll update my progress with CoderByte in this post. Answers are up on a github repo.

6/14/15 - finished with 28/30 Easy ones. While analyzing other user’s methods, I noticed how ‘elementary’ my methods are (using arrays to temporary hold my answers instead of just returning the answer, lack of functional javascript, etc.). I’m looking forward to seeing my progress when I attempt the same questions in several months.
